info.title: ClickUp MCP Server
info.description:
ClickUp MCP server usage rules:

Use ClickUp Tools: When handling requests related to ClickUp, task management, project management, or to-do lists, always use your ClickUp tools.

Task Query Workflow: When asked about tasks for a specific person, ALWAYS complete this 3-step workflow: 1) Call getWorkspaces to get workspace/team IDs, 2) Call getTeamMembers with team_id to find the user's numeric ID by their name, 3) Call searchTeamTasks with assignees[] set to that user ID. Do NOT stop after finding the user - proceed to fetch their tasks.

Hierarchy Understanding: ClickUp uses this hierarchy: Workspace (team) > Space > Folder > List > Task. Navigate down the hierarchy to find specific items.

Use Filters: When searching tasks, always use filters (assignees, statuses, dates) to avoid slow responses. Never call searchTeamTasks without filters unless specifically asked for all tasks.

Creating Tasks: To create a task, first get the list_id from getListsInFolder or getListsInSpace, then call createTaskInList with the list_id and task details.

Assignee IDs: User IDs for assignees must be numeric integers obtained from getTeamMembers. Names cannot be used directly - always look up the ID first.

get.summary: Get Workspace IDs (Step 1 - start here for any task query)
get.description: ALWAYS CALL THIS FIRST. Returns all workspaces. Use the workspace 'id' as 'team_id' in subsequent calls. For task queries: Step 1) Call this, Step 2) Call getTeamMembers with team_id, Step 3) Call searchTeamTasks with assignees[].

200.description: Object containing array of workspaces. Use the workspace 'id' as 'team_id' to get spaces via getSpaces endpoint.

teams.description: Array of workspaces. Each workspace id can be used to get spaces via /team/{team_id}/space

id.description: Workspace ID. Use this as team_id when calling getSpaces and other team endpoints

get.description: Returns all spaces in the specified workspace. First call getWorkspaces to get workspace IDs, then use those IDs here as team_id. Spaces are the top-level organizational containers within a workspace.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: The workspace ID from getWorkspaces response (the 'id' field of a workspace/team)

200.description: Object containing array of spaces in the workspace

spaces.description: Array of spaces in this workspace

id.description: Space ID. Use this as space_id for folder/list operations

post.description: Create a new space in the workspace.

get.description: Get all tasks in a list. Use filters to narrow down results. Without filters this returns all tasks which may be slow.

parameters.name: assignees[]
parameters.description: Filter by assignee user IDs. Get user IDs from getTeamMembers.

parameters.name: due_date_gt
parameters.description: Due date greater than (Unix timestamp in ms)

parameters.name: due_date_lt
parameters.description: Due date less than (Unix timestamp in ms)

200.description: Array of tasks matching the filters

post.description: Create a new task in a list. The list_id can be obtained from getListsInFolder or getListsInSpace. Required field: name. Optional: description, priority (1=urgent, 4=low), due_date (Unix timestamp in ms), assignees (array of user IDs from getTeamMembers).

get.description: Get full details of a single task by its ID. Returns all task properties including name, description, status, assignees, due dates, custom fields, etc. Use this after searchTeamTasks to get complete details of a specific task.

put.description: Update task properties like name, description, status, priority, due date, or assignees. Only include fields you want to change in the request body.

delete.description: Permanently delete a task. This action cannot be undone. Use with caution.

get.summary: Search Tasks by Assignee (Step 3 - call after getTeamMembers)
get.description: REQUIRED TOOL for getting tasks assigned to a user. WORKFLOW: 1) Call getWorkspaces to get team_id, 2) Call getTeamMembers with team_id to find the user's numeric ID from their name, 3) Call THIS ENDPOINT (searchTeamTasks) with assignees[] set to that user ID. You MUST complete all 3 steps when asked about a person's tasks. Example: For 'get tasks for John', find John's ID from getTeamMembers, then call searchTeamTasks with assignees[]=[john_id]. Without the assignees filter this returns ALL tasks which is slow.

parameters.name: assignees[]
parameters.description: Filter by assignee user IDs. Get user IDs from getTeamMembers endpoint.

parameters.name: due_date_gt
parameters.description: Due date greater than (Unix timestamp in ms)

parameters.name: due_date_lt
parameters.description: Due date less than (Unix timestamp in ms)

parameters.name: custom_fields[]
parameters.description: Filter by custom field values as JSON

200.description: Array of tasks matching the filters

get.summary: Get User IDs by Name (Step 2 - then call searchTeamTasks)
get.description: Get all members (users) in a workspace. IMPORTANT: When asked for tasks by person name, find their numeric 'id' from this response, then IMMEDIATELY call searchTeamTasks with assignees[] set to that ID. Do NOT stop after finding the user - proceed to get their tasks.

200.description: Object containing array of workspace members

members.description: Array of members. Find user by username, extract their 'id', then call searchTeamTasks with assignees[]=[id]

id.description: User ID. Use this for assignee filtering in search endpoints

post.description: Invite a user to a workspace by email.

admin.description: Set to true to make user a workspace admin

get.description: Get user details within a workspace.

put.description: Update a user's role or permissions on a workspace.

delete.description: Remove a user from the workspace.

post.description: Add an existing task to a list (for tasks in multiple lists).

delete.description: Remove a task from a list.

get.description: Get how long a task has been in each status.
